intro: Grewia elatostemoides, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments.
